event_description: Apple reported record-breaking financial results for its fiscal Q2 2021 (ending March 27, 2021), with revenue of $89.6 billion, a 54% increase year-over-year, and quarterly earnings per diluted share of $1.40. All product categories and geographic segments saw strong double-digit growth, and the company announced a $90 billion increase to its share repurchase program and a 7% dividend increase. [3, 9, 11, 19]

The antitrust lawsuit brought by Epic Games against Apple, concerning Apple's App Store policies and in-app purchasing methods, proceeded to trial in May 2021. Epic Games challenged Apple's 30% revenue cut and restrictions on alternative payment systems. [12, 14, 18]
